languageKey.label: Types that are made available in resource records.

The Resource Type record is made available for selection in the Resource record. The Resource Type title will be listed in the drop-down selection box of a Resource record, and the Visible Resource Fields affect what properties of a Resource are shown.
The language of this resource type.
This should be the default language unless this resource type represents a translation of another language.
Uniquely identifies this Resource Type
The Title field will be shown in the drop-down list of a Resource record.
tx_wecsermons_resources:type
Specifies whether this SMS Resource Type is a default resource type, or a plug-in resource type.
The plug-in type provides additional fields shown in See Also below.
tx_wecsermons_resource_types:querystring_param,tx_wecsermons_resource_types:rendering_page
The subpart marker defined in the template file.
Marker name is the TYPO3 tag that is used for the subpart in a template file. The subpart describes how resources of this type are rendered. See the documentation of this extension for details.
The subpart marker defined in the template file, that explains how resources of this type are rendered, displayed, in single view.

Template name defines the template subpart that will render resources of this type in single view. Single view is defined by the plugin, and renders a single record. Resource single views have their own template, which is defined by this field. See the documentation of this extension for details.
The mime type is used in XML feeds, such as podcasts, to specify the MIME type of the file that will be included in the feed.

Files that will be included in XML feeds need to have a MIME type associated with them in order for the feed to be valid. If you wish you use resources of this type in podcasts, then you should provide a MIME type here so that the podcast will be "valid".
You can validate a feed here: http://validator.w3.org/feed/
You can read more about MIME types at: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mime_type
The general description given for this resource type.
The description can be used to briefly describe the resource type.
An icon that represents this resource type.
The icon is a small image representing the type.
Select which fields you would like to make available on resources of this type.

Visible Resource fields are those fields you wish resources of this type to possess. The available fields are description, icon, file, and any of three web addresses or urls. When assigning this type to a new SMS Resource record, these fields will be available.
The plug-in's parameter that is appended to the query string.

The query string parameter is important for being able to view the records of another extension. This defines part of the query string that another extension will use to display or render one of its records. I.e. the tt_news extension uses the query string parameter: tx_ttnews[tt_news]=3, to render the tt_news record with UID = 3. Knowing this requires researching the extension you wish you use with the SMS plug-in, and entering the appropriate string.
Most often, this will be in the format of: tx_<plugin_name>[<variable>] I.e.: tx_jkpoll_pi1[uid]
The page which will render or display the single view of the plug-ins record.

The page that is configured with an instance of the plug-in being associated with resource. That page should have the plug-in installed and configured for use. Please see the extensions own documentation on how to configure it for use.
The name of the TypoScript object, which can be defined for advanced output on the Front End.
Assigning the TypoScript object name, you are able to reference this name in the setup field of a template record at plugin.tx_wecsermons_pi1.resource_types { ... } and
